meanings.definition: To cover or soil with dung.
meanings.sent1: The farmer will bedung the fields with manure.
meanings.sent2: The dog bedunged the garden with its waste.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids decided to bedung the schoolyard with mud.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain bedunged the streets with dirt and debris.
meanings.sent5: The careless gardener accidentally bedunged the freshly cut grass with fertilizer.

meanings.sent1: The gardener will bedung the plants to help them grow.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often bedung their crops to improve soil quality.
meanings.sent3: The idea to bedung the garden with compost was met with skepticism.
meanings.sent4: The ancient practice of bedunging fields with animal waste has been effective for centuries.
meanings.sent5: The decision to bedung the orchard with organic fertilizer led to a bountiful harvest.
